author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the guidelines for auto-merging. Please make sure that you have read the [General registry README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md) and the [AutoMerge guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/). The following guidelines were not met:

- Name is not at least 5 characters long
- Package name similar to 6 existing packages.
  1. Similar to Bplus. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 1 between lowercased names is at or below cutoff of 1.
  2. Similar to Flux. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2. Normalized visual distance 1.91 is at or below cutoff of 2.50.
  3. Similar to Pluto. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  4. Similar to Opus. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  5. Similar to Plots. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  6. Similar to Pipe. Normalized visual distance 2.05 is at or below cutoff of 2.50.

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

After you have fixed the AutoMerge issues, simply retrigger Registrator, which will automatically update this pull request. You do not need to change the version number in your `Project.toml` file (unless of course the AutoMerge issue is that you skipped a version number, in which case you should change the version number).

If you do not want to fix the AutoMerge issues, please post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged. Then, send a message to the `#pkg-registration` channel in the [Julia Slack](https://julialang.org/slack/) to ask for help. Include a link to this pull request.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have also read the package naming guidelines: https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->
`Plus` is very likely not a possible package name, but the package is also missing documentation.
The package is also empty, so it is definitely not ready for registration. Please have a look at https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General?tab=readme-ov-file#should-i-register-my-package-now
Thank you for the suggestions Goerz! I am learning to develop new packages. The next package would be a good one!

Don't let this first attempt discourage you! :-)

And sorry if I was a bit shortâ€¦ I was reviewing the PR on my phone. Now that I have full keyboard, let me try to be more welcoming.

You probably want to work with Julia for a bit and get to know the development process more before submitting packages to the registry. In addition to the FAQ in the General README, I would also point you to one of my [Discourse replies on package registration](https://discourse.julialang.org/t/when-does-it-make-sense-to-post-a-new-package-to-the-julia-repository/108701/4).

You might find the [`LocalRegistry` package](https://github.com/GunnarFarneback/LocalRegistry.jl) useful to understand package registration better without impacting the General registry. If you have any general questions about package development or registration, the best place to ask is probably the [Julia Discourse](https://discourse.julialang.org).
